Hey guys

It is possible, I am just porting this bit of functionality from =
my
original AI framework.

Basically, you have to create a class that exten=
ds
NEATGATrainingManager and overrides initialise().  In the new
initialise=
() method, call super.initialise(0 and then create the robot
NNs from the G=
A population. You can then put these in an arena where
you feed the nets re=
alt time inputs eg speed, direction etc.  As your
bot goes around it will b=
e given a raw score based on your criteria. 
Assign this score to the nets =
Chromosome.  Your fitness function then
becomes very simple. 

	public doub=
le evaluate(Chromosome genoType) {
		return (genoType.fitness());
	}

Is al=
l it needs to be.  The evolution process then takes place as
normal and a n=
ew generation is born.

If you want me to look over any code, feel free to =
email it to me.

I will place a tutorial up soon (work is busy - family is =
young - time
is therefore short) that shows how to evolve a chess player. 
=
Different domain, but similar principals in that there is no input data.

A=
ny queries, please ask.  I want this software to be as useful as
possible. =
 

Cheers

Matt

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "iwaneicher" <reicher@...> wr=
ote:
>
> Hi,
> We're two students and our task is to find a NN that is able=
 to
> control a hexapod robot. To find a suitable NN, we want to use a
> Ge=
netic Algorithm. Inputs for the NN are leg positions, ground contact
> sens=
ors for each leg, desired walking speed and so on. Outputs of the
> NN are =
the next positions for all the joints.
> 
> Know my question:
> Within the =
XOR-Example (I runned NEATGATrainingManager) the Neural Net
> will be train=
ed with data provided by the xor/xor.csv file. 
> In our Application (robot=
) we don't have any training data available,
> we just want to evolve neura=
l networks and evaluate them by applying
> the fitness function. (for examp=
le how fast walks the robot,
> direction, etc.) How do we start NEAT, so th=
at it does not need a
> trainig set? Is there an example/tutorial available=
 that shows how to
> use NEAT without a training set? Unfortunately, I coul=
dn't work it out
> so far how to do it.
> 
> Thanks a lot for any informati=
on!
> 
> Iwan
>
